translated: Birth Stories
The Book of Elevens
The Chapter on Mother’s Keeper
The Birth Story of Dhamma Prince

analyzed: yasokaro puñña karaḥ ham asmi  samaṇa brāhmaṇāna
translated: “I am the one who makes merit and brings glory,🔽The one who benefits ascetics and brahmins six times a day.
I am worthy of the path, revered by gods and humans.
I am Dhamma. Give me the path.”
“Having firmly mounted the path of unrighteousness,
I am powerful and not at peace.
For what reason should I give you blame?
I have never given the path before.”
“Dhamma indeed appeared in the past,
But later unrighteousness arose in the world.

original: Jeṭṭho ca seṭṭho ca sanantano ca,
analyzed: jeṭṭhaḥ ca seṭṭhaḥ ca sanantano ca
translated: The elder, the best, the eternal one,
Go on the path of the younger brother of the elder.”

original: “Na yācanāya napi pātirūpā,🔽Na arahatā tehaṁ dadeyyaṁ maggaṁ;
analyzed: na yācanāya na pi pātirūpā  na arahatā dadeyyam magga
translated: “It is neither by begging nor by being suitable🔽That I would give you the path, O Worthy One.

analyzed: yuddham ca naḥ hotu ubhin amajja
translated: Let there be a battle between us today,
In the battle, the victor will get the path.”
“I am spread out in all directions,
Powerful, of immeasurable glory, incomparable.
Having attained all good qualities,
How will you, Dhamma, defeat unrighteousness?
Iron is what cuts gold,
Gold does not cut iron.

original: Sace adhammo hañchati dhammamajja,🔽Ayo suvaṇṇaṁ viya dassaneyyaṁ.
analyzed: sace adhammaḥ hañchati dhamma majja  ayaḥ suvaṇṇam viya dassaneyya
translated: If unrighteousness should prevail over righteousness,🔽Iron would be more beautiful than gold.
If you are strong in battle, unrighteous one,

original: Na tuyha vuḍḍhā ca garū ca atthi;
analyzed: na tuyha vuḍḍhā ca garū ca atthi
translated: You have no elders or superiors;

analyzed: maggam ca te dammi piya appiyena
translated: I give you the path of what is loved and what is not loved,
And I forgive your harsh words.”
Having heard these words, the unrighteous one
Fell down with his head lowered,
Thinking, ‘If I do not get a battle,
To this extent the unrighteous one is defeated.
The one with the strength of patience, having conquered the strength of battle,
Having killed unrighteousness and buried it in the ground,
Pāyāsi, having mounted his chariot,

original: Maggeneva atibalo saccanikkamo.🔽Mātā pitā samaṇabrāhmaṇā ca,
analyzed: maggena iva atibalaḥ sacca nikkamaḥ  mātā pitā samaṇa brāhmaṇā ca
translated: With great strength, following the path of truth.🔽Those who do not respect their mother, father, ascetics, or brahmins
Right there in their own home,
Having left behind this body,
When their body breaks up, they go to hell;
Just like the fallen unrighteous one.
Those who respect their mother, father, ascetics, and brahmins,
who are well-honored in their own homes,
who leave their bodies right here,
after the breakup of the body, they go to a good destination,
just as the Dhamma ascends the sandalwood mountain.”
The Birth Story of Dhammadevaputta, the Third.
